page.title: 19ARMY CAMP TARRANT VALLEY
page.content: In the SW corner of our block is Blandford camp.As only a small part of the camp is in our block we decided to leave the details to the people doing the block next to ours.The army have had a camp there since the Civil War in 1642.A hutted camp was built at Collingwood corner in our block since the first world war and the name Collingwood comes from a Navy admaral. The Americans had a hospital on the site during the second world war but the School of Signals Regiment which is there now is stationed in a new camp built between 1964 and 1971.Also in the area is Race Down and it is here that they held horse racing and motor cycle racing in the past but all that is finished now.
